Description: THIS IS A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE U.S. FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE  USFWS  AND WHITE MOUNTAIN APACHE TRIBE  TRIBE.  THIS AGREEMENT IS BEING IMPLEMENTED TO FOSTER COOPERATION ON A GOVERNMENT-TO-GOVERNMENT BASIS IN MEXICAN WOLF MONITORING, MANAGEMENT, AND RECOVERY TO IMPLEMENT THE CURRENT PROVISIONS FOR THIS SPECIES AS SET FORTH IN THE USFWS  2017 MEXICAN WOLF RECOVERY PLAN  AND SUBSEQUENT REVISIONS  AND REINTRODUCTION OBJECTIVES AS SET FORTH IN THE 2015 10 J  RULE  AND SUBSEQUENT REVISIONS , AND THE PROVIDE FOR IMPLEMENTATION OF THE TRIBE S MEXICAN WOLF MANAGEMENT PROGRAM ON THE FORT APACHE INDIAN RESERVATION, AS SET FORTH IN THE WHITE MOUNTAIN APACHE TRIBE MEXICAN WOLF MANAGEMENT PLAN.A JUNE 24, 2019, MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING BETWEEN THE USFWS AND TRIBE  AND OTHER COOPERATORS  CONSTITUTES SUBSTANTIAL FEDERAL AND COOPERATOR INVOLVEMENT AND ESTABLISHES A FRAMEWORK FOR COLLABORATION THAT IS BASED IN SOUND SCIENCE, AND WHICH ENABLE THE USFWS AND TRIBE  AND OTHER COOPERATORS  TO DEVELOP MUTUALLY-AGREEABLE, LONG-TERM COLLABORATION IN REINTRODUCTION AND RECOVERY OF MEXICAN WOLVES IN ARIZONA AND NEW MEXICO.
IMPROVED ARCHIVING OF MEXICAN WOLF (CANIS LUPUS BAILEYI) SPECIMENS IN THE MSB DIVISION OF MAMMALS
ASSIST WITH MEXICAN WOLF RECOVERY PROGRAM BY MAINTAINING A CAPTIVE BREEDING AND PRE-RELEASE FACILITY AT THE LADDER RANCH, HILLSBORO, NEW MEXICO.
ARIZONA GAME AND FISH DEPARTMENT - MEXICAN WOLF RECOVERY

FUNDS UNDER THIS AWARD ARE FOR A SSP (SPECIES SURVIVAL PLAN), WHICH IS A COOPERATIVE MANAGEMENT CONSERVATION PROGRAM FOR SELECTED SPECIES IN NA FACILITIES
DEVELOPED BY THE ASSOCIATION OF ZOOS AND AQUARIUMS (AZA) TO HELP ENSURE THE SURVIVAL OF THREATENED OR ENDANGERED SPECIES IN THE WILD.
THIS FUNDING WILL BE USED TO MAINTAIN AND ADD TO A GENETIC REPOSITORY OF MEXICAN WOLF AND OTHER CANID SAMPLES THAT WE DEVELOPED OVER THE LAST 5 YEARS.
